docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: United Nations Sanctions (Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action—Iran) Regulation

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means—(a)a police officer;(b)a member of the Customs and Excise Service holding an office specified in Schedule 1 to the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342); or(c)a public officer employed in the Customs and Excise Department in the Trade Controls Officer Grade;
Commissioner (關長) means the Commissioner of Customs and Excise, any Deputy Commissioner of Customs and Excise or any Assistant Commissioner of Customs and Excise;
Joint Commission (聯合委員會) means the Joint Commission established in the JCPOA;
licence (特許) means a licence granted under Part 3; (L.N. 107 of 2024)

nuclear-related item (核項目) means any item, material, equipment, goods or technology set out in the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1 or the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 10/Part 2; (L.N. 107 of 2024)

pilot in command (機長), in relation to an aircraft, means the pilot designated by the operator or the owner, as appropriate, as being in charge of the aircraft (without being under the direction of any other pilot in the aircraft) and charged with the safe conduct of a flight;

prohibited person (受禁制人士) means—(a)Iran;(b)a national of Iran;(c)an entity incorporated in Iran or subject to Iranian jurisdiction;(d)a person or entity acting on behalf of, or at the direction of, Iran, a national of Iran or an entity mentioned in paragraph (c); or(e)an entity owned or controlled by Iran, a national of Iran or an entity mentioned in paragraph (c);

uranium commercial activity (鈾商業活動) means a commercial activity that involves uranium mining, or the production or use of nuclear materials or technology listed in the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1. (L.N. 107 of 2024)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Prohibition against supply, sale or transfer of nuclear-related items to Iran

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 13(1)(a), a person must not supply, sell or transfer, or agree to supply, sell or transfer, directly or indirectly, or do any act likely to promote the supply, sale or transfer of, any nuclear-related item— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to Iran;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the use in or benefit of Iran.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the item concerned was a nuclear-related item; or (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the item concerned was or was to be supplied, sold or transferred—

subparagraph.content: to Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran;
to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or
for the use in or benefit of Iran.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Prohibition against carriage of nuclear-related items to Iran

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship that is not registered in the HKSAR and is within the waters of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is registered in the HKSAR;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an aircraft that is not registered in the HKSAR and is within Hong Kong air space;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any other ship or aircraft that is for the time being chartered to a person who is—

subparagraph.content: in the HKSAR;
both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a vehicle in the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 2, except under the authority of a licence granted under section 13(1)(b), a ship, aircraft or vehicle must not be used for the carriage of any nuclear-related item if the carriage is, or forms part of, a carriage— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from a place outside Iran to a place in Iran;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: for the use in or benefit of Iran.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the carriage of the nuclear-related item is performed in the course of the supply, sale or transfer of the nuclear-related item; and (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supply, sale or transfer was authorized by a licence granted under section 13(1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: If a ship, aircraft or vehicle is used in contravention of subsection (2), each of the following persons commits an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a ship registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator and the master of the ship;

subparagraph.content: the operator of the ship, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and
the master of the ship, if the master is in the HKSAR or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an aircraft registered in the HKSAR—the charterer, the operator and the pilot in command of the aircraft;

subparagraph.content: the operator of the aircraft, if the operator is in the HKSAR, or is both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national, or is a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a vehicle—the operator and the driver of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (4) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the item concerned was a nuclear-related item; or (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the carriage of the item concerned was, or formed part of, a carriage—

subparagraph.content: from a place outside Iran to a place in Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran;
for the use in or benefit of Iran.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition against provision or transfer of certain assistance, training, services or resources related to nuclear-related items

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 16(1)(a), a person must not provide, directly or indirectly, any technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services related to the supply, sale, transfer, manufacture or use of any nuclear-related item— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to Iran;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a destination or person for the purpose of provision, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran.

subsection.leadIn: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 16(1)(b), a person must not transfer, directly or indirectly, any financial resources or services related to the supply, sale, transfer, manufacture or use of any nuclear-related item— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to Iran;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a destination or person for the purpose of transfer, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (4) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services concerned were or were to be provided—

subparagraph.content: to Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or
to a destination or person for the purpose of provision, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services concerned related to the supply, sale, transfer, manufacture or use of the nuclear-related item concerned.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (5) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the financial resources or services concerned were or were to be transferred—

subparagraph.content: to Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or
to a destination or person for the purpose of transfer, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the financial resources or services concerned related to the supply, sale, transfer, manufacture or use of the nuclear-related item concerned.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Prohibition against sale and acquisition of interest in uranium commercial activity

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2) and (3) apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person acting in the HKSAR; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting outside the HKSAR who is—

subparagraph.content: both a Hong Kong permanent resident and a Chinese national; or
a body incorporated or constituted under the law of the HKSAR.

subsection.content: Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 19(1)(a), a person must not sell or otherwise make available, directly or indirectly, an interest in a uranium commercial activity to a prohibited person.

Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 19(1)(b), a person must not knowingly provide, directly or indirectly, any financial services or related services that facilitate the acquisition of an interest in a uranium commercial activity by a prohibited person.
Except under the authority of a licence granted under section 19(1)(c), a prohibited person must not, directly or indirectly, acquire an interest in a uranium commercial activity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (5) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the interest concerned was an interest in a uranium commercial activity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the interest concerned was sold or otherwise made available to a prohibited person.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (7) to prove that the person did not know and had no reason to believe that the interest concerned was an interest in a uranium commercial activity.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Licence for supply, sale, transfer or carriage of nuclear-related items to Iran

subsection.leadIn: If satisfied on application that the requirements in subsection (3) or (4) are met, the Chief Executive must, subject to subsection (6), grant, as appropriate— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a licence for the supply, sale or transfer of, or the doing of an act likely to promote the supply, sale or transfer of, nuclear-related items— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

subparagraph.content: to Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran;
to a destination or person for the purpose of delivery or transfer, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or
for the use in or benefit of Iran; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a licence for the carriage of nuclear-related items which is, or forms part of, a carriage— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

subparagraph.content: from a place outside Iran to a place in Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran;
for the use in or benefit of Iran.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are that— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

subparagraph.content: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the item is approved in advance on a case-by-case basis by the Security Council; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any equipment covered by B.1 of the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1 when such equipment is for light water reactors;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: low-enriched uranium covered by A.1.2 of the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1 when it is incorporated in assembled nuclear fuel elements for light water reactors; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an item set out in the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 10/Part 2 when it is for exclusive use in light water reactors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements, as appropriate, of the guidelines as set out in the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1 and the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 10/Part 2 are met; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive has obtained and is in a position to exercise effectively a right to verify the end-use and end-use location of the item. (L.N. 107 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are that— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the item is directly related to—

subparagraph.content: the necessary modification of 2 cascades at the facility of the Fordow Fuel Enrichment Plant for stable isotope production;
the export of Iran’s enriched uranium in excess of 300 kg in return for natural uranium; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supply, sale, transfer or carriage of the item is undertaken strictly in accordance with the JCPOA;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the requirements, as appropriate, of the guidelines as set out in the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1 and the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 10/Part 2 are met; and (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive has obtained and is in a position to exercise effectively a right to verify the end-use and end-use location of the item.

subsection.content: If the Chief Executive determines that the requirements in subsection (4) are met, the Chief Executive must cause the Security Council and the Joint Commission to be notified of the intention to grant the licence not less than 10 days before the grant of the licence.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Licence for provision or transfer of certain assistance, training, services or resources related to nuclear-related items

subsection.leadIn: If satisfied on application that the requirements in subsection (2) or (3) are met, the Chief Executive must, subject to subsection (4), grant, as appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a licence for the provision of technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services related to the supply, sale, transfer, manufacture or use of any nuclear-related item—

subparagraph.content: to Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a licence for the transfer of financial resources or services related to the supply, sale, transfer, manufacture or use of any nuclear-related item—

subparagraph.content: to Iran;
to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran; or
to a destination or person for the purpose of transfer, directly or indirectly, to Iran or to, or to the order of, a person connected with Iran.

subsection.leadIn: The following requirements apply to the provision of technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the provision is directly related to— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

subparagraph.content: the necessary modification of 2 cascades at the facility of the Fordow Fuel Enrichment Plant for stable isotope production;
the export of Iran’s enriched uranium in excess of 300 kg in return for natural uranium; or

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the requirements, as appropriate, of the guidelines as set out in the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 13/Part 1 and the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 10/Part 2 are met; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive has obtained and is in a position to exercise effectively a right to verify the end-use and end-use location of the technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services. (L.N. 107 of 2024)

subsection.content: The following requirement applies both to the provision of technical assistance or training, financial assistance, investment, brokering or other services and to the transfer of financial resources or services; the provision or transfer is approved in advance on a case-by-case basis by the Security Council. (L.N. 107 of 2024)

If the Chief Executive determines that the requirements in subsection (2) are met, the Chief Executive must cause the Security Council and the Joint Commission to be notified of the intention to grant the licence not less than 10 days before the grant of the licence.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Licence for sale and acquisition of interest in uranium commercial activity

subsection.leadIn: If satisfied on application that the requirement in subsection (2) is met, the Chief Executive must grant, as appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a person a licence for the sale or otherwise making available of an interest in a uranium commercial activity to a prohibited person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a person a licence for the provision of financial services or related services that facilitate the acquisition of an interest in a uranium commercial activity by a prohibited person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a prohibited person a licence for the acquisition of an interest in a uranium commercial activity.

subsection.content: The requirement is that the sale or making available of an interest, the provision of the financial services or related services or the acquisition of an interest in the uranium commercial activity is approved in advance on a case-by-case basis by the Security Council.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Provision of false information or documents for purpose of obtaining licences

subsection.leadIn: A person who, for the purpose of obtaining a licence, makes any statement or provides or produces any information or document that the person knows to be false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, for the purpose of obtaining a licence, recklessly makes any statement or provides or produces any information or document that is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Licence or permission granted by authorities of places outside HKSAR

subsection.content: If the circumstances described in subsection (2) apply, a provision of this Regulation that prohibits the doing of a thing by a person except under the authority of a licence does not have effect in relation to any such thing done in a place outside the HKSAR by the person.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the circumstances are that the thing is done by the person under the authority of a licence or with permission granted, in accordance with any law in force in that place outside the HKSAR (being a law substantially corresponding to the relevant provision of this Regulation), by the authority competent in that behalf under that law.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Investigation of suspected ships

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer has reason to suspect that a ship to which section 3 applies has been, is being or is about to be used in contravention of section 3(2), the officer may— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: either alone or accompanied and assisted by any person acting under the officer’s authority, board the ship and search it and, for that purpose, use or authorize the use of reasonable force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the charterer, operator or master of the ship to provide any information relating to the ship or its cargo, or produce for inspection any of its cargo or any document relating to the ship or its cargo, that the officer may specify.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer has reason to suspect that a ship to which section 3 applies is being or is about to be used in contravention of section 3(2), the officer may, for the purpose of stopping or preventing the use of the ship in contravention of section 3(2) or to pursue enquiries, either there and then or on consideration of any information provided or cargo or document produced in response to a request made under subsection (1)(b), do one or more of the following— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct the charterer, operator or master of the ship to refrain, except with the consent of an authorized officer, from landing, at any port specified by the authorized officer, any part of the ship’s cargo that is so specified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: request the charterer, operator or master of the ship to take any of the following steps—

subparagraph.content: to cause the ship and any of its cargo not to proceed with the voyage on which the ship is then engaged or about to be engaged until the charterer, operator or master is notified by an authorized officer that the ship and its cargo may so proceed;

if the ship is in any other place, to take the ship and any of its cargo to a port specified by an authorized officer, and to cause the ship and its cargo to remain in that place until the charterer, operator or master is notified by an authorized officer that the ship and its cargo may depart;
to take the ship and any of its cargo to another destination specified by an authorized officer in agreement with the charterer, operator or master.

subsection.leadIn: A power conferred by this section to request a person to provide any information or produce any cargo or document for inspection includes a power to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify whether the information should be provided orally or in writing and in what form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the time by which, and the place in which, the information should be provided or the cargo or document should be produced for inspection.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Offences by charterer, operator or master of ship

subsection.content: A charterer, operator or master of a ship who disobeys any direction given under section 22(2)(a), or, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to comply with a request made under section 22(1)(b) or (2)(b) within the time specified by an authorized officer or, if no time is specified, within a reasonable time, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

A charterer, operator or master of a ship who, in response to a request made under section 22(1)(b) or (2)(b), provides or produces to an authorized officer any information or document that the charterer, operator or master knows to be false in a material particular, or recklessly provides or produces to an authorized officer any information or document that is false in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Power of authorized officers to enter and detain ships

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 23, if an authorized officer has reason to suspect that a request that has been made under section 22(2)(b) may not be complied with, the officer may take any steps that appear to the officer to be necessary to secure compliance with that request including, in particular, any of the following steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter or authorize the entry on any land or the ship concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detain or authorize the detention of that ship or any of its cargo;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use or authorize the use of reasonable force.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), subsection (1) does not authorize the detention of a ship for more than 12 hours.

The Chief Secretary for Administration may, by order in writing, authorize the detention of a ship for further periods of not more than 12 hours each, and the order must state the time from which, and period for which, the order is effective.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Investigation of suspected aircraft

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer has reason to suspect that an aircraft to which section 3 applies has been, is being or is about to be used in contravention of section 3(2), the officer may— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: either alone or accompanied and assisted by any person acting under the officer’s authority, board the aircraft and search it and, for that purpose, use or authorize the use of reasonable force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the charterer, operator or pilot in command of the aircraft to provide any information relating to the aircraft or its cargo, or produce for inspection any of its cargo or any document relating to the aircraft or its cargo, that the officer may specify.

subsection.content: If the aircraft referred to in subsection (1) is in the HKSAR, an authorized officer may, either there and then or on consideration of any information provided or cargo or document produced in response to a request made under subsection (1)(b), further request the charterer, operator or pilot in command of the aircraft to cause the aircraft and any of its cargo to remain in the HKSAR until the charterer, operator or pilot in command is notified by an authorized officer that the aircraft and its cargo may depart.

subsection.leadIn: A power conferred by this section to request a person to provide any information or produce any cargo or document for inspection includes a power to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify whether the information should be provided orally or in writing and in what form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the time by which, and the place in which, the information should be provided or the cargo or document should be produced for inspection.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Offences by charterer, operator or pilot in command of aircraft

subsection.content: A charterer, operator or pilot in command of an aircraft who, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to comply with a request made under section 25(1)(b) or (2) within the time specified by an authorized officer or, if no time is specified, within a reasonable time, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

A charterer, operator or pilot in command of an aircraft who, in response to a request made under section 25(1)(b) or (2), provides or produces to an authorized officer any information or document that the charterer, operator or pilot in command knows to be false in a material particular, or recklessly provides or produces to an authorized officer any information or document that is false in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Power of authorized officers to enter and detain aircraft

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 26, if an authorized officer has reason to suspect that a request that has been made under section 25(2) may not be complied with, the officer may take any steps that appear to the officer to be necessary to secure compliance with that request including, in particular, any of the following steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter or authorize the entry on any land or the aircraft concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detain or authorize the detention of that aircraft or any of its cargo;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use or authorize the use of reasonable force.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), subsection (1) does not authorize the detention of an aircraft for more than 6 hours.

The Chief Secretary for Administration may, by order in writing, authorize the detention of an aircraft for further periods of not more than 6 hours each, and the order must state the time from which, and period for which, the order is effective.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Investigation of suspected vehicles

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer has reason to suspect that a vehicle in the HKSAR has been, is being or is about to be used in contravention of section 3(2), the officer may— (L.N. 107 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: request the operator or driver of the vehicle to provide any information relating to the vehicle or any article carried on it, or produce for inspection any article carried on it or any document relating to the vehicle or any article carried on it, that the officer may specify; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: further request, either there and then or on consideration of any information provided or article or document produced in response to a request made under paragraph (b), the operator or driver to take the vehicle and any article carried on it to a place specified by an authorized officer, and to cause the vehicle and the article to remain in that place until the operator or driver is notified by an authorized officer that the vehicle and the article may depart.

subsection.leadIn: A power conferred by this section to request a person to provide any information or produce any article or document for inspection includes a power to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify whether the information should be provided orally or in writing and in what form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the time by which, and the place in which, the information should be provided or the article or document should be produced for inspection.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Offences by operator or driver of vehicle

subsection.content: An operator or driver of a vehicle who, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to comply with a request made under section 28(1)(b) or (c) within the time specified by an authorized officer or, if no time is specified, within a reasonable time, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

An operator or driver of a vehicle who, in response to a request made under section 28(1)(b) or (c), provides or produces to an authorized officer any information or document that the operator or driver knows to be false in a material particular, or recklessly provides or produces to an authorized officer any information or document that is false in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Power of authorized officers to enter and detain vehicles

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 29, if an authorized officer has reason to suspect that a request that has been made under section 28(1)(c) may not be complied with, the officer may take any steps that appear to the officer to be necessary to secure compliance with that request including, in particular, any of the following steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter or authorize the entry on any land or enter or authorize the entry into the vehicle concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detain or authorize the detention of that vehicle or any article carried on it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use or authorize the use of reasonable force.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), subsection (1) does not authorize the detention of a vehicle for more than 12 hours.

The Commissioner may, by order in writing, authorize the detention of a vehicle for further periods of not more than 12 hours each, and the order must state the time from which, and period for which, the order is effective.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Production of proof of identity
section.content: Before or on exercising a power conferred by section 22, 24, 25, 27, 28 or 30, an authorized officer must, if requested by any person so to do, produce proof of the officer’s identity to the person for inspection.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Power of magistrate or judge to grant warrant

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate or judge may grant a warrant if satisfied by information on oath given by an authorized officer that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under this Regulation has been committed or is being committed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on any premises specified in the information, or on any ship, aircraft or vehicle so specified, evidence in relation to the commission of the offence.

subsection.content: A warrant granted under subsection (1) may authorize any authorized officer, together with any other person named in the warrant, to enter the premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle specified in the information or any premises on which the ship, aircraft or vehicle so specified may be, at any time within one month from the date of the warrant, and to search the premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A person authorized by a warrant to search any premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle may exercise any or all of the following powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: search any person who is found on, or whom the authorized person has reasonable grounds to believe to have recently left or to be about to enter, the premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: seize and detain any document, cargo or article found on the premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle or on any person referred to in paragraph (a) that the authorized person has reasonable grounds to believe to be evidence in relation to the commission of an offence under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take in relation to any document, cargo or article seized under paragraph (b) any other steps that may appear necessary for preserving the document, cargo or article and preventing interference with it.

subsection.content: A person may only be searched under this section by a person who is of the same sex.
If a person is empowered under this section to enter any premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle, the person may use any force that is reasonably necessary for that purpose.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Detention of documents, cargoes or articles seized

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), any document, cargo or article seized under section 32(3) may not be detained for more than 3 months.

If the document, cargo or article is relevant to an offence under this Regulation, and proceedings for the offence have begun, the document, cargo or article may be detained until the completion of those proceedings.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Disclosure of information or documents

subsection.leadIn: Any information or document provided, produced or seized under this Regulation may be disclosed only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who provided or produced the information or document or from whom the document was seized has given consent to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information or document is disclosed to a person who would have been empowered under this Regulation to request that it be provided or produced;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the information or document is disclosed on the authority of the Chief Executive, subject to the information or document being transmitted through and with the approval of the instructing authority, to—

subparagraph.content: any organ of the United Nations;
any person in the service of the United Nations; or
the Government of any place outside the People’s Republic of China,

paragraph.continued: for the purpose of assisting the United Nations or that Government in securing compliance with, or detecting evasion of, measures in relation to Iran decided on by the Security Council; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the information or document is disclosed with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any proceedings for an offence under this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person may not give consent to the disclosure if the person has obtained the information or possessed the document only in the person’s capacity as servant or agent of another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person may give consent to the disclosure if the person is entitled to the information or to the possession of the document in the person’s own right.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Liability of persons other than principal offenders

subsection.content: If the person convicted of an offence under this Regulation is a body corporate and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect on the part of, any director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other similar officer is guilty of the like offence.

If the person convicted of an offence under this Regulation is a firm and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect on the part of, any partner in the firm or any person concerned in the management of the firm, the partner or the person concerned in the management of the firm is guilty of the like offence.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Offences in relation to obstruction of authorized persons, etc.
section.content: A person who obstructs another person (including a person acting under the authority of an authorized officer) in the exercise of the powers of that other person under this Regulation commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Offences in relation to evasion of this Regulation
section.leadIn: A person who destroys, mutilates, defaces, secretes or removes any document, cargo or article with intent to evade any of the provisions of this Regulation commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Consent and time limit for proceedings

subsection.content: Proceedings for an offence under this Regulation may only be instituted by or with the consent of the Secretary for Justice.

Summary proceedings for an offence under this Regulation that is alleged to have been committed outside the HKSAR may be commenced at any time not later than 12 months from the date on which the person charged first enters the HKSAR after the alleged commission of the offence.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Access to Security Council documents
section.leadIn: The Director-General of Trade and Industry is to make available at his or her office, for inspection by the public during normal office hours, free of charge, an English version and a Chinese version of each of the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 10/Part 2.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Exercise of powers of Chief Executive

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may delegate any of the Chief Executive’s powers or functions under this Regulation to any person or class or description of person.
The Chief Executive may authorize a person to whom a power or function is delegated to sub-delegate it to any other person or class or description of person.
A delegation or authorization under subsection (1) or (2) may be subject to any restrictions or conditions that the Chief Executive thinks fit.
